title: Authorities are offering $80K for information about the suspected Texas shooter
description: Police say 38-year-old Francisco Oropesa shot five people to death in a home in Cleveland, Texas, early Saturday and then fled the area. Investigators are still searching for the suspect.

title: Pope Francis says he is open to helping return Ukrainian children taken to Russia
description: Speaking from the papal plane, Francis said he would be willing to help facilitate the return of children taken to Russia since the war began. And he revealed a secret peace "mission" was under way.

title: 2 teens were killed in a shooting at a house party on the Mississippi Gulf Coast
description: Police have charged a 19-year-old man for killing two and wounding for others in the city of Bay St. Louis, about 15 miles west of Gulfport.

title: Elephants are a menace for these 6th graders. Then they went on a safari ...
description: Botswana has one of the last thriving elephant herds – and a history of human-elephant conflict that threatens both sides. A nonprofit has a program to shift that dynamic. Will it work?

title: Neil Young and Snoop Dogg joined Willie Nelson on stage for a 90th birthday concert
description: 17,000 fans turned up to the Hollywood Bowl for a concert by Willie Nelson and his famous friends. Owen Wilson, Helen Mirren, Ethan Hawke and Jennifer Garner all did the introductions.

title: More people are getting away with murder. Unsolved killings reach a record high
description: U.S. murder clearance or solve rates have hit an all-time low. Experts say mutual mistrust between police and some communities is creating a vicious cycle where unsolved killings breed more mistrust.

title: We asked, you answered: What's your secret to staying optimistic in gloomy times?
description: From watching the sun rise — yeah, it's a cliche but it works! — to dancing to techno music to doing good for others to just plain smiling, readers share what gives them optimism in times of trouble.

title: 30 years ago, one decision altered the course of our connected world
description: On April 30, 1993, the World Wide Web was released into the public domain. It revolutionized the internet and allowed users to create websites filled with graphics, audio and hyperlinks.

title: King Charles III's coronation will feature Jews, Muslims, and other faiths too
description: King Charles III, keen to show that he can be a unifying figure, will be crowned in a ceremony that will for the first time include faiths other than the Church of England.

title: A pilot takes a big risk to save a skydiver's life
description: In 1970, Alan Ayers was preparing himself for a skydiving competition in Gainesville, Florida. It wasn't the first time he'd jumped out of a plane, but it was almost his last.

title: Metallica's new album, 72 Seasons, has met critical acclaim. What's their secret?
description: On their new record 72 Seasons, Metallica proves they're still making inspired music for hardcore fans. For a metal band with many of its members approaching 60, that's no small feat.

title: NASA is keeping Voyager 2 going until at least 2026 by tapping into backup power
description: Engineers have bought the spacecraft's interstellar mission more time by using backup power from a safety mechanism. It means NASA no longer has to shut down one of its five scientific instruments.

title: Toni Morrison's diary entries, early drafts and letters are on display at Princeton
description: Toni Morrison remains the sole Black female recipient of a Nobel Prize in Literature. Princeton University, where Morrison was a professor, is commemorating the 30th anniversary of her win.

title: Biden makes fun of his age at the White House Correspondents' dinner
description: The president leaned on self-deprecation at the Washington, D.C., soiree and took jabs at Fox News and Don Lemon. Headliner comedian Roy Wood Jr. roasted scandal-plagued media figures and politicians.
